fitting noun
(CLOTHES)
[ C ] an occasion when someone who is having clothes made for them puts on the clothes before they are finished to make certain they will fit: I'm having the final fitting of my wedding dress on Thursday.

fitting noun
(IN A HOUSE)
[ C usually plural ] UK (US furnishings) an object in a house, such as a cooker or a shelf, that is not permanently fixed, and can be either taken away or left when the people who live there move to another house: fixtures and fittings The house price, including fixtures and fittings, is £200,000.
